bibl.title: The Dating of 'Fayum' Mummy Portraits: A Papyrological Perspective.
bibl.note: Preliminary survey, using the evidence of the palaeography of the portrait inscriptions as an alternative method of dating. - Pl. 31: New York, Met. Inv. 18.9.2 = Parlasca I 167 (= S.B. XVI, 12341). Last quarter of the second century. - Pl. 32: Dijon, Musée des Beaux-Arts Inv. GA 5 = Parlasca I 236. Late first century or first quarter of second century. - Pl. 33: Berlin, Ant. Inv. 31161/50 = Parlasca III 664. First quarter of third century.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists

bibl.seg: MONTSERRAT Dominic, The Dating of 'Fayum' Mummy Portraits: A Papyrological Perspective.
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists (Copenhagen, 1994) pp. 578-581 et pll. 31-33.

Preliminary survey, using the evidence of the palaeography of the portrait inscriptions as an alternative method of dating. - Pl. 31: New York, Met. Inv. 18.9.2 = Parlasca I 167 (= S.B. XVI, 12341). Last quarter of the second century. - Pl. 32: Dijon, Musée des Beaux-Arts Inv. GA 5 = Parlasca I 236. Late first century or first quarter of second century. - Pl. 33: Berlin, Ant. Inv. 31161/50 = Parlasca III 664. First quarter of third century.
